thread.title: West Limestone sweeps Clements Cross-Country Invitational
thread.title_full: West Limestone sweeps Clements Cross-Country Invitational

author: jonathan@athensnews-courier.com(Jonathan Deal)
title: West Limestone sweeps Clements Cross-Country Invitational
text:
by Jonathan Deal 
Clements senior Mack Van Wagnen defended his turf Tuesday afternoon with a first-place finish at the Clements Invitational Cross-Country race. The Clements senior won the race with a time of 17 minutes, 5 seconds. 
Van Wagnen’s time was 23 seconds faster than his closest competitor. It was the second time he has won the 5K race in the past three years. 
West Limestone took home first place as a team with three runners in the top 10. Kent Wilburn led the way for the Wildcats with a time of 17:28, good enough for second-place. Other West top finishers were Nick Roberson (18:21) and Austin Abernathy (18:28). 
Elkmont had two runners finish in the top 10. Chase Prater (17:33) and Chance Bailey (17:54) helped the Red Devils to a third-place finish. 
The race featured more than 100 runners and 10 teams. 
Clements finished in fourth, followed by Athens and Athens Bible. Athens top runner was Garrett Clark, 10th place, with a time of 19:04. Athens Bible’s top runner was Nicolas Ulrich (18:18) in seventh place. 
Varsity girls 
West Limestone dominated the varsity girls race with five of the top seven runners, led by Cassidy Winter’s first-place finish. Valeria Vizcarra (21:50), Reilly Hooie (21:52), Rainey Tyler (22:04) and Hannah Jackson (22:34) were West Limestone’s other top runners. 
Elkmont narrowly beat Athens Bible for second place. Elkmont’s top runner was Claudia Allen with a time of 22:04 while Athens Bible’s Baylee Romine finished sixth with a 22:28. 
Abby Craig was Elkmont’s top runner with a time of 24:05 to help her team finish fifth. Athens’ Lillian Bradford finished 11th as an individual with a time of 23:31. 
Jesse Owens Classic 
West Limestone’s Cassidy Winter ran Saturday in the Girls Gold Division at the Jesse Owens Classic. The 17th annual race attracted runners from around the Southeast with the Gold Division consisting of the most elite runners. 
Winter finished 21st with a time of 18 minutes, 41 seconds. Rebecca Story, the winner at 16:57, represented Christian Academy in Knoxville. 
West Limestone finished 23rd out of 33 teams in the Gold Division. Other West runners competing in the race were Reilly Hooie (20:43), Valeria Vizcarra (21:03), Rainey Tyler (21:20) and Hannah Jackson (22:39). 
Javan Winders (15:15), from Henry County High School in McDonough, Georgia, was the top overall runner in Boys Gold Division. 
Bronze Division 
West Limestone finished sixth in the Boys Bronze Division with five runners in the top 80. More than 400 runners from 39 teams competed in the Bronze race, which was designated for schools in Classes 4A-7A. 
Kent Wilburn (17:20) was West Limestone’s top runner. Other Wildcats contributing to the sixth-place finish were Elijah Jackson (17:57), Jayce Thornton (18:28), Austin Abernathy (18:29) and Nick Roberson (18:34). 
Samuel Smith, of West Blocton High School was the Boys Bronze Division race winner at 16:27. Chase Richardson, at 19:25, ran East Limestone’s best time. 
The Bronze Girls race featured 286 runners on 25 teams. Sarah Rose (23:09) was West Limestone’s top runner. East Limestone’s Mallory Jo Mitchell finished in 25:40. 
Green Division 
Clements’ Mack Van Wagnen (16:38) was the top Limestone County runner at the Jesse Owens Classic with a fourth-place finish in the Boys Green Division, designated for schools in Classes 1A-3A. 
Van Wagnen’s time was better than 336 runners in the Green Division. The senior helped Clements finish 17th out of 35 teams. Other Clements runners in the race were Richard Hodges (17:50) and D.J. Croskey (19:22). 
Clements had two runners — Anslee Gordon (24:01) and Abby Craig (24:37) — finish among the top 100 in the Girls Green Division race. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
